title: Limitations of Project Management Maturity Models and Flexible Application Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic project management concepts and understanding of fundamental models
context.additional_context: Learning focused on flexible management strategies in undefined project environments and integrating non-curricular elements (context, human factors, etc.)

learning_goals: Learners can comparatively analyze structural features and limitations of various project management maturity models.
Learners can propose three or more flexible management strategies applicable to uncertain project environments.
Learners can explain the impact of non-processual factors (e.g., customer engagement, expertise, trust) on maturity through case-based analysis.
Learners can design a process for analyzing project management problems using multi-method research designs.

resources: Collaboration Tools (Online Whiteboard, Document Sharing Platform)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
